column4: I am trying to install 9.10. I have a dual boot XP/8.10 and I formatted the ubuntu partition. I am now running 9.10 live cd. At the "prepare disk space" screen it says "This computer has no operating system on it." Why?
is your hard disk recognized?
yes
Sofia:can you see your partitions?
if I select "Specify partitions manually", I can see all of them
MBR was not cleaned ? I mean, can you boot as usually, right?
I think so. I just formatted the ubuntu partition using gparted live cd
can you reboot and try?, just to make sure MBR was not touched
ok, trying now...
Strange! I can still boot in ubuntu and in XP!
can you explain to me what you want to do?
I want to install Karmic from scratch AND still be able to dual-boot in XP
Btw, ubuntu doesn't really boot, it just shows the loading screen. WHich means that boot sector is ok, right?
yep, but GRUB v1 is on it, Karmic uses Grub2
I was told that I should be able to do what I want without messing with grub. Grub2 will be automatically installed. Or not?
maybe that's the problem, I suggest you to "fixmbr" (clean GRUB from MBR, and restore XP NT-loader) and retry runnin LiveCD
can you explain a bit more, please? Do I just run fixmbr from command line or what?
that's Windows stuff, I think there's Rescue Mode in XP where you can restore mbr issuing fixmbr command, maybe you can find more help on ho to restore MBR in ##windows channel
Does it matter that I have a separate boot partition?
you want a fresh install and you are using XP then I guess it does not matter
ok, ty!
np
